question: What gets wetter the more it dries?
hints: Drying can be done in multiple ways.
Some things are designed for drying.

question: You see me in water but I never get wet. What am I?
hints: You can see me but you can't touch me.

question: What has holes but holds water?
What has only two words but thousands of letters?
hints: There are many kinds of letters.

question: What becomes more useful when broken?
What is harder to catch the faster you run?
hints: The word catch can be used in many ways.

question: What has four fingers and a thumb but is not living?
What has many keys, but can't even open a single door?
hints: Take a guess and you'll see.

question: I can only live where there is light, but I die if the light touches me. What am I?
hints: Everything has one in the light.

question: Give me food and I will live. Give me water and I will die. What am I?
hints: You'll get hurt if you get too close to me.
You can see and feel me, but you can't touch me.

question: I'm tall when I'm young and I'm short when I'm old. What am I?
What has hands but cannot clap?
What can run but cannot walk?
What never asks questions but is often answered?
hints: Questions aren't the only thing you can answer.

question: What kind of coat can only be put on when wet?
hints: There are many types of coat.
You can't wear this type of coat.

question: What gets sharper the more you use it?
If I have it, I don't share it. If I share it, I don't have it. What is it?
hints: Some people love them, some people hate them.
Mysterious people may have a lot of them.

question: What can you catch but not throw?
hints: Something no one wants to catch.
It can have a big effect on your mood.

question: What goes up and down but still remains in the same place?
hints: You don't want to fall around them.

question: What has a head and a tail but no body?
hints: Some people use them to make decisions.

question: Poor people have it. Rich people need it. If you eat it you die. What is it?
hints: Close your eyes and you can see it.
Even when all else is gone, it remains.

question: What goes up when rain comes down?
hints: What do you do when it starts raining?.
You can get it in a tropical drink.

question: What travels around the world but stays in one corner?
What is so delicate that saying its name breaks it?
hints: You'll find it in a library.

question: What is always coming, but never arrives?
What goes through towns and over hills but never moves?
hints: Cities have a lot of these.

question: What has a neck but no head?
What do you throw out when you want to use it, but take back when you are done?
What flies around all day but never goes anywhere?
What gets bigger the more you take from it?
hints: It must be empty to exist.
You do not want to fall in a deep one.

question: What gets whiter the dirtier it gets?
hints: They are not used much today.

question: What runs around a garden without moving?
hints: It can get knocked over or broken.
There are many forms of running...

question: He has married many women, but has never been married. Who is he?
hints: He is close to someone but has never met them.

question: What has one eye but cannot see?
hints: The size of the eye can vary.

question: What can you never eat for breakfast?
hints: It's a fact, not an opinion.

question: What has a heart but no other organs?
Take off my skin, I won't cry, but you will. What am I?
hints: You'll cry but you won't be sad.

question: What is easy to get into, but hard to get out of?
hints: If you get into this badly, you could be arrested.

question: What has four wheels and flies?
hints: It comes to you once a week.

question: What falls often but never gets hurt?
hints: It is cold when it falls.
Sometimes lots of it falls but other times you barely notice it falling at all.

question: What is black when you buy it, red when you use it, and grey when you throw it away?
hints: It can be used for cooking.

question: The more of it you take, the more of it you leave behind. What is it?
hints: They are easily seen when it is snowing.

question: What belongs to you but others use it more than you do?
hints: Everyone allows others to use theirs.

question: I am as light as a feather, yet no man can hold me for long. What am I?
hints: Some people can hold it longer than others.
Some smell nice but not all.

question: I have cities, but no houses. I have mountains, but no trees. I have water, but no fish. What am I?
hints: It needs to be updated often.

question: Many have heard me, but nobody has seen me, and I will not speak back until spoken to. What am I?
hints: They can only say what you say.

question: What tastes better than it smells?
What stays where it is when it goes off?
hints: It goes off in the mornings.
No one likes having it happen.

question: I start with the letter E, I end with the letter E. I contain only one letter, yet I am not the letter E. What am I?
hints: There are many forms of letter.

question: What building has the most stories?
